title: 111_hr4258
content: The "Public Private Vocational Partnership Act of 2009" allows for donations to secondary schools and community colleges for vocational education purposes under section 45R of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The "Public Private Vocational Partnership Act of 2009" allows corporations to claim a vocational education donation credit under section 38 of the Internal Revenue Code. The credit includes 90% of the fair market value of qualified property donations and intern credit amounts. There are limitations, such as a $50,000 cap on property donations and a $100 credit per month for qualified interns. The taxpayer can claim a credit for interns, with a maximum of $6,000 per intern. Qualified property donations refer to charitable contributions of tangible personal property to educational organizations for use within the United States for educational purposes. The taxpayer can claim a credit for interns, with a maximum of $6,000 per intern. Qualified property donations are charitable contributions of tangible personal property to educational organizations for educational purposes. The property must meet certain criteria to be considered qualified, including fitting into the donee's education plan and meeting minimum functionality standards. A qualified intern is a full-time student in a secondary school or community college. A qualified intern is a full-time student in a secondary school or community college, employed for up to 20 hours per week as part of an approved vocational education course. Secondary school refers to a school offering vocational education, while a community college is a regionally accredited institution providing a 2-year program acceptable for credit towards a bachelor's degree. The text discusses the aggregation rule for determining a single employer under specific sections and the coordination with Section 170(b) to reduce the limitation for taxable years. Additionally, it mentions the amendment to the general business credit section of the Code. The text introduces a new paragraph regarding vocational education donation credits for corporations under section 45R(a) of the Code. It also includes amendments to Section 280C and a conforming amendment to the table of sections. Effective Date: The amendments made by this section apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2009.
